data.blog_name: What Is The Most Common Problem With A Refrigerator?
data.blog_content_text:
Each mechanical device requires the proper maintenance, likewise a refrigerator. Even the fridge is categorized as an essential appliance in the home. It is because this appliance is fruitful in keeping your food fresh for a more extended period. In summer, you can easily make the ice cream and keep it in the fridge.

Apart from it, as it works daily, you may sometimes observe problems in working of this appliance. Some refrigerator problems can be resolved in your house. On the other hand, some technical issues require technical help. Besides these, for solving the problem, you should know the exact root causes of problems.

Fixing the problem does not mean unplugging or re-plugging the switch. You need to contact the buyer for the particular refrigerator issue. In addition to it, here is a list of some of the most common problems with the refrigerator. 

Water leakage This problem can be tricky if someone falls on the floor because of this water leakage. There are two major causes of this significant problem. The first and foremost reason is the defrost drain. You can look to the back wall of the freezer to check the defrost drain. Debris can be the reason for water leaking in the defrost drain.

With the help of a long and thin pipe, you can work on removing the clog. On the other hand, the second reason is the frozen water supply. It does not only lead to water leakage but also to the puddle under the fridge.

#1. It Is Not Cold Enough

Sometimes, you may observe that your refrigerator is not cool enough. Due to it, most of your items which are kept in fridge ruins and frozen items are not getting too much-frozen effect. However, this problem is not cumbersome to resolve. All you need to do is look for the back wall of the freezer, whether it is cold or not.

In this case, it was cold then I heard the sound of the evaporator fan running. If you did not attend to the sound, there is some issue with the freezer evaporator fan. In the second case, if you listen to the sound, then check for their compressor. Clean this part of the refrigerator.

#2. The Ice Maker Is Not Working

It is also another problem that you may experience in your refrigerator. It indicates that the ice maker motor requires replacement. In addition to it, another reason can be clogged water. Look for the screen, either it is plugged with debris or not.

In addition to it, the problem in the ice-making mechanism is also another problem to look for. All you need to do is call the pro or experts to resolve the problem with the ice maker. 

#3. Noise In Refrigerator 

Usually, the refrigerator does not create too much noise daily. If you suddenly observe the noise in your refrigerator, then it may cause trouble with the fan. The majority of refrigerators consist of the condenser fan and evaporator fan. The working time of both of these fans is the same. Due to it, the refrigerator can be loud.

Also Read- Tips and Tricks to Maintain a Refrigerator

Either it is the condenser fan or evaporating fun; if one of them has a problem, it leads to noise. All you need to do is call the buyer and discuss all the issues. Further, a service member will come to your home and resolve this problem.

#4. High Electricity Consumption 

As per the BEE ratings, the fridge consumes electricity. It is recommendable to look for the five stars ratings while purchasing. It leaves to the highly energy-efficient appliance. 

If you compare the older model with the modern one, you may find older ones consume high electricity compared to the new one. You can solve this problem by replacing the older one with a modern one.

#5. Warm Refrigerator 

The primary purpose of the refrigerator is for cooling and keeps the food that is placed in it fresh. If you observe the heat in your refrigerator, then you should consider the cause of this. To get rid of this problem, you should work on cleaning the condenser coil.

If you are still facing a problem, you should look for the condenser fan motor to ensure the perfect condition.

#6. The Door Does Not Shut

It is another most common problem that is usually observed in the refrigerator. The primary reason is that the strip which is fruitful in sealing the refrigerator door wears out. Moreover, it is not difficult to replace.

Further, if you think that it is a cup of your tea, then continue; otherwise, call a pro. Most of the time, older refrigerators face this issue.

In the end, these are some most common problems that are easy to fix. All you need to do is get the appropriate guidance on the exact issue of your refrigerator. Due to it, you will find the precise solution to this problem.

data.blog_title: How Do I Know If My Water Purifier Needs Service?

data.blog_name: How Do I Know If My Water Purifier Needs Service?
data.blog_content_text:
A water purifier shows various signs that indicate it needs services. Usually, low water yielding, annoying noise, unpleasant odor in water are the most common signs that your water purifier shows asking for services. However, the water purifier expert advises that a water purifier should get proper treatment at a regular and periodic time interval of 3 months.

A huge Indian population is unaware of the fact that regular and periodic water purifier service makes the device efficient and long-lasting. In our society people only hire a technician to get their water purifier service done when the device completely stops bringing clean water. The main reason behind it is unawareness of the fact that when should one get their water purifier service done. 

In this post we’ll be discussing the right time to get your water purifier service done so if you face the same problem and are unaware about “how I know if my water purifier needs service” then read this post till the end and get your doubt clear. But before we start exploring our main topic let’s discuss the importance of getting regular water purifier service. 

The Importance Of Timely RO Service

  • On-time water purifier service offers you a nonstop supply of pure water

  • Timely service adds life to the water purifier and their filters

  • Scheduled maintenance keeps your water purifier maintenance cost in control

  • Regular service prevents early breakdown and frequent repairs

It is also important to know the cause behind the water purifier before diving into its detailed service and maintenance. You have to consider the right time to schedule preventive management that includes the current condition of the consumables. There are few majors that may affect the water purifier performance-

1.  The level of impurities suspended in the raw water

2.  TDS level of water and the hardness

3.  The exact amount of water to be purified

4.  The frequency of preventive maintenance

Filters and membranes are the most vital parts of any water purifier that includes sediment, carbon, and other filters. The standard time to replace the filters and membranes of a water purifier is around 6-8 months or the frequency of use. You have to diagnose the current condition of these constituents inside your water purifier.

Also Read- Why Is RO Water Purifier Service Important?

Check The Condition Of Sediment Filter

A sediment filter is used to cut out dirt and soil particles from raw water as the primary filter, the sediment filter also has a key role in maintaining and protecting the other membranes. When you overlook changing the filter at the suggested time, the dirt penetrates the sediment filter and pollutes the purified water. An out of order sediment filter can lead to various health conditions.

Don’t Forget To Diagnose The Carbon Filter

The polluted water is blackish and carries a bad smell which makes it unfit for direct consumption. In the case of municipal water, chlorine is added to purify water before supplying it to your homes. The chlorine can purify polluted water to a certain level, but it leaves a smell in the water. Here comes the role of carbon filters to remove chlorine and other chemical traces present in water. This is why it is vital to change the carbon filter at least once a year to remove odors effectively.

Follow The Standard Schedule To Change The Filter And RO Membrane

Serial no

Type of filter and membrane

Duration of usage

1

Sediment filter

12 months

2

Carbon filter

12 months

3

RO membrane

1-2 years

In the process to decontaminate the water to make it drinkable as it carries an excess of minerals and salts. These elements can induce severe health conditions if they are not eliminated before consuming. Water either uses filtration, sedimentation, and distillation to remove physical and chemical pollutants.

Most of the water purifiers need to be serviced in 3-6 months as you can experience some abnormalities in your water purifier when it exceeds more than 12 months. 

The Different Types Of Water Purifier Needs Specific Service Requirements

#1. RO Water Purifier

RO uses a semi-permeable membrane to remove dissolved solids as chlorine, nitrates, and sulfates from polluted water. To keep your RO system in tip-top condition, it needs to be cleaned once every 12 months. After cleaning thoroughly, drain out water from the tank and insert the required filters and membranes. You must avoid immediate water consumption after service as it is good to throw out at least 1 tank of water.

#2. UV Water Purifier Maintenance Tips

In case of UV water purifier maintenance, the UV lamp must be exchanged after 12 months if you wish to remove microbes, bacteria, pathogens, and viruses successfully. Normal cleaning can be good enough to flush out the killed germs and make it durable for extended use.

#3. Ultrafiltration Water Purifier

When the water goes through the UF membrane, it eradicates solids, and viruses like the RO water purifier does. The hollow fiber membrane of the UF filter separates pollutants from raw water by a particularly larger membrane than RO that works well up to one year.

#4. Don’t Overlook The Drips And Water Leakages

If you are tired of experiencing drips in your water purifier, get in touch with an expert technician to schedule a doorstep check-up. Make sure the leaks are properly sealed to neglect the kind of leakage and drip in the near future.

#5. One Can Buy An AMC Plan

Annual maintenance contracts make it easier to maintain a water purifier better than before at the lowest cost possible. There are a lot of RO AMC plans available online that make it easy to maintain your water purifier’s original efficiency and produce minimum hassles.

#6. Know-How Long Your Water Purifier Lasts

You should know the exact life cycle of the water filters as sediment as pre-filter, carbon pre-filter, RO membrane, and the activated carbon as the post filter. Each of the membrane and filters needs to be either cleaned or replaced to keep the continuous flow of pure water.

However, these filters have a limited life span; it majorly depends upon the usage and type of water. When your water remains under service, it appears some signals that indicate it needs service. If you are facing a problem with the taste, color, and your RO system keeps working the whole day but can't fill the tank.

#7. The Problem With The Water Pressure

The low water pressure in the sign of the under service as the filter needs to be cleaned or replaced to bring back the original water flow. The water purifier finds it hard to purify water when its filters are clogged and produce low water pressure.

#8. Altered water taste

Noticing any bad taste in water is the sure-shot sign of the filter problem as it needs to be exchanged promptly. You can either experience a taste of chlorine, soil, and others that is a result of improper water filtration.

#9. The Continuously Running Water Purifier

A water purifier is a non-stop working machine, but once the water storage tank fills completely, it stops automatically. Your water purifier finds it hard to fill the tank when there is a problem with water flow, or it's getting insufficient water inlet. A continuously running water purifier system needs to be checked and resolved to get the best outcomes from your water purifier.

Summarizing

A water purifier generally has 5-7 filters to achieve the kind of purity and eliminate diverse pollutants. Apart from cleaning and sanitizing, and changing the filter on a regular basis, you can also think about installing a water softener to extend the water purifier’s performance. 

Never ignore checking the water purifier when you notice any decline in water purifier performance to get free access to odorless and healthy water.

data.blog_name: Why We Need RO Service?
data.blog_keywords: ro service, water purifier service, need of ro service
data.blog_content_text:
We are living in a highly polluted world and consuming polluted water, air and food. There is no secret to making these things pure and pollution-free. We human beings are one of the prime reasons behind the deterioration of water. Surface water bodies are turned into drainage because of the uncontrolled dumping of toxic wastes. Because of the pollution in water, tap water also needs to be purified before consumption.

The reason why people need a water purifier is to remove all kinds of biological, chemical and physical pollutants. The water purifier has different types of filters and membranes to eliminate all sorts of suspended impurities. The RO water purifier can eliminate smaller than 10 microns particles that are the reason why it needs frequent service and repair.

The frequency of RO service depends on the quantity and quality of pollutants that must be eliminated. A water quality test is the best way to get your best-matched water purifier. The water purifier expert suggests a water purifier on the basis of the presence of suspended pollutants.

Types Of Water Purifier And Its Frequent Service Needs

Understanding every water purifier is really tough as it is important to go through the generally used water purifiers. The water quality expert suggests you RO, UV, and UF water purifiers depending on the tap water quality.

1. Reverse Osmosis (RO) - Reverse osmosis system ideal option in case of having high TDS levels. RO water purifier effectively removes excess salts and heavy metals, and other toxins from water. TDS controller is also used along with the RO technology to prevent eliminating essential minerals from water.

2. UV water purifier (UV) – it is a UV lamp powered water purifier to disinfect water by removing suspended pollutants. The UV water purifier effectively works on all water sources, whether you are purifying tap or municipally supplied water. The exact amount of pollutants present in water is diagnosed at a water testing laboratory.

3. UF water purifier (UF) – ultrafiltration is a fine membrane that can eliminate minute pollutants of less than 10 microns. Sometimes it is a gravity-based UF water purifier that doesn't need any external power source to operate. Gravity based water purifier works well where there is a low water TDS level.

What Type Of Pollutants Present In The Raw Water?

There is a diverse range of pollutants that may be present in water that including physical, chemical, and biological. Further, it can categorize into bacteria, nitrates, pesticides, and excess salts are some of the commonly found scums. To extract the exact kinds of pollutants, you can go for a laboratory water quality test.

If your tap water contains a high amount of contaminants and microbes, choose the RO+UV+UF water purifier. The UV membrane penetrates the cells of bacteria and stops the multiplication, as the RO membrane traps the dead cells and other biological pollutants. So, when you use the following water filters in a single water purifier, it gives you 100% pure and disease-free water.

Need Of Timely RO Service And Maintenance

Reverse Osmosis, known as RO, is the most commonly used water purification technique used for household purposes. The RO is a special kind of water filtration technology in which water is deionized by pushing it under pressure using a semi-permeable membrane. The water then moves from the more concerted side to the less concerted side to offer pure drinking water.

 The clean water is known as permeate, and the leftover is known as a brine that can be used for other household purposes. The RO membranes play a central role in the water purification process; that’s why it needs timely replacement of RO filters and membranes when it is not serviced on time. To improve the productivity of your RO water purifier, regular servicing and repair are essential.

A RO filter is like the heart of the RO water purifier that filters out suspended wastes from the raw water and ensures only the cleanest and safest drinking water for you. With continuous use, physical and biological contaminants clog the filter, damaging the filter permanently.

Also Read- Why Is RO Water Purifier Service Important

The other filters and carbon-based filters also lose their penetrable properties with respect to time and need regular replacement. That’s why it needs to maintain the RO membrane and needs to replace the RO filter on time or before the due date.

How Often Can The RO Filters Be Serviced Or Replaced?

The pre-filter RO, installed outside the RO water purifier, must be changed within six months; further, it depends on the quality and quality of water purified per hour. The most commonly used pre-filters such as DI cartridge activated carbon and sediment filter should be replaced within 6 to 12 months. The frequency of how many liters of water passes through the RO membrane, but it decided only the filter should be inspected thoroughly.

To keep your RO membrane safe and working properly, it is mandatory to change the RO filters within 1 year. Apart from filters, the RO membrane needs to be replaced every 2 years. If RO service is not scheduled before the due date, the pollutants and chemicals may be found in your drinking water because of the inability of the RO membrane, which can be injurious to health.

The Summary About The Need Of RO Service

The above information is helpful for every RO user. Still, the actual time and frequency of the RO service completely depend on the amount of water is filtered through the RO membrane, the impurities are present in your tap water, and the service cycle. In a nutshell, if you have been using your RO filter for almost a year or more than that, it needs to get serviced replaced before it stops working. If your RO service is due for more than months or a year, why not find the nearest RO service center to get it serviced?

You can raise the RO service request in one tap without having to call multiple people or fill the RO service form.  The mobile apps are a one-stop-shop for all your RO water purifier service, customer complaints, and installation requests. In this way, you know when your RO is serviced and filters membranes replaced. So, download the RO service app that helps you to keep your RO serviced and well-working condition.

data.blog_title: Air Conditioner Noise Reduction Techniques for a Quieter Home
data.blog_description: A properly maintained air-conditioning system is the best solution to cherish a quiet air-cooling technology. Professional technicians ensure thorough cleaning of the air filters, gaps, and nozzles in the right way.
data.blog_name: Air Conditioner Noise Reduction Techniques for a Quieter Home
data.blog_content_text:
In this scorching summer heat, the last thing you want to put your mind to is the condition of your AC. Air conditioners hold massive power to calm the ambiance of a living space. But if it is making loud and strange sounds throughout the time you are using it, it is challenging to cherish the advantages of your air conditioner. The good news is that you can now use some tactful ways to reduce the humming or hissing sound. With the help of the following tactics, you can not only keep your AC sound but also keep it running in a good condition.

Pick a Comparatively Quieter AC Unit

When buying a new AC unit, you must take into account the noise rating. You can look up models with a specific design for quiet operation. Modern units generally come with noise-cutting features like vibration-absorbing components, insulated compressor elements, and more. If you are still deciding whether to choose an AC unit based on your specific needs, get in touch with HVAC experts. They can help you find the ideal AC system according to your requirements.

Appropriate Isolation and Placement

The place where your AC unit is installed plays a significant role in reducing the noise. It is vital to establish your air-conditioner far from your living space and mainly your bedroom. It is best to avoid installing them in areas where the level of sensitivity is high. One can use foam or rubber pads under the unit to trap the vibration and cease it from going through the walls or floors.

Daily Maintenance of your AC Unit

A properly maintained air-conditioning system is the best solution to cherish quiet air-cooling technology. Professional technicians ensure thorough cleaning of the air filters, gaps, and nozzles in the right way. AC Maintenance experts can look for moulds and oil-moving sections within the unit. Sometimes, loose connections are one of the common reasons for noise caused due to friction with the AC. They can also detect any loose connections with the AC unit and fix them to prevent unnecessary glitches.

Clean or Replace your Air Filters

Clogged AC filters are another reason AC units tend to make noises. Blocked filters in your air conditioner unit often make your overall system and mechanism work harder than usual. Replacing or simply cleaning your air filter once in a while can ensure adequate airflow. However, the air filter cleaning and replacement techniques and timings vary per every AC model. Therefore, you can seek assistance from the manufacturer's recommended guidelines to follow the perfect air filter replacement schedule.

Invest In a Sound Blanket

If you have already been experiencing noises from your AC, you must explore the benefits of sound blankets. These blankets are an excellent way to stifle the hissing sound coming out of your AC unit. There are many air conditioner companies that design sound blankets especially to match the model or making of a particular air conditioner. When you search online, you will find ample options available. Therefore, it is best to follow the recommendations made by the experts to choose the right blanket for your AC.

Install a Plywood Fence around Your Unit

If you last replaced your unit a while ago and it has turned old or worn out, your AC might have started to make noise. Installing a thin fence around your AC can create a barrier to the sound between your AC unit and you. This barrier often helps in muffling the noise coming out of your AC. One can install a fence of three feet height and simultaneously 3 feet spacing on all sides. One of the best materials to build the fence is plywood. Plywood fences are affordable and are a great way to examine if it is going to be a proper solution to noise reduction. If it works, you are suitable to install a permanent one around your air conditioner unit.

It is also imperative to note that maintaining a 3 feet gap around your unit perimeter is essential. Confining the AC unit too tightly can overheat the unit. This can cause serious damage to your air conditioner's functionality and ruin your home’s cooling capacity.

Clean Up the AC Fan Blades

If the motor of the condenser is not the source of the sound, there are some basic AC maintenance tips you can follow. Simple building of debris and dust on the fan blades can reduce the efficiency and power of your air conditioner. Not only that, it can also create a certain sound that might disrupt your sound sleep. One of the best tools for cleaning your fan blades and AC is the vacuum. It would help if you also remembered that the perfect time to replace your AC unit air filters is while you tend the blades. It is wise to consult reputed AC cleaning and maintenance professionals for a comprehensive AC maintenance service. RO Care can be your trusted cleaning partner to provide your air conditioner with the solution it needs this summer.

data.blog_title: Franchise vs Startup: Making the Right Business Choice
data.blog_description: In the realm of entrepreneurship, the decision between starting a franchise and launching an independent startup is pivotal. Each path comes with its own set of advantages and challenges, influencing the trajectory of your business journey.
data.blog_name: Franchise vs Startup: Making the Right Business Choice
data.blog_content_text:
In the realm of entrepreneurship, the decision between starting a franchise and launching an independent startup is pivotal. Each path comes with its own set of advantages and challenges, influencing the trajectory of your business journey. Let’s delve into why taking a franchise might be the right move for some aspiring entrepreneurs, despite the allure of starting from scratch.

1. Established Brand Recognition: 
One of the most significant benefits of opting for a franchise is tapping into an established brand with a loyal customer base. This instant recognition can significantly reduce the time and resources needed to build brand awareness, giving franchisees a head start in the competitive market.

2. Proven Business Model: 
Franchises offer a tested and proven business model, complete with operational systems, marketing strategies, and training programs. This mitigates much of the risk associated with starting a new venture, as franchisees can rely on a blueprint for success honed through years of experience.

3. Ongoing Support and Training: 
Franchise agreements typically come with ongoing support and training from the franchisor. This invaluable assistance can range from site selection guidance to marketing assistance, providing franchisees with a safety net as they navigate the challenges of business ownership.

4. Higher Success Rates: Statistics show that franchises generally have higher success rates than independent startups. This can be attributed to the combination of brand recognition, proven systems, and ongoing support, which collectively contribute to a greater likelihood of profitability.

Conclusion:
While starting a franchise may not offer the same level of creative freedom as launching an independent startup, the benefits of brand recognition, proven business models, and ongoing support make it an attractive option for many entrepreneurs. Ultimately, the decision between franchise and startup hinges on individual goals, risk tolerance, and industry preferences. It’s crucial to weigh the pros and cons carefully before embarking on either path.

Regards,
Kunnu Singh
Womenpreneur - IIMC

data.blog_title: The Superiority of Service Franchises Over Product Franchises
data.blog_description: In the world of franchising, the debate between service franchises and product franchises often arises. While both offer lucrative opportunities for entrepreneurs, service franchises hold a distinct edge over their product-based counterparts.
data.blog_name: The Superiority of Service Franchises Over Product Franchises
data.blog_content_text:
In the world of franchising, the debate between service franchises and product franchises often arises. While both offer lucrative opportunities for entrepreneurs, service franchises hold a distinct edge over their product-based counterparts.

Firstly, service franchises typically require lower initial investment compared to product franchises. With service-based businesses, overhead costs such as inventory and storage are significantly reduced or even eliminated altogether. This makes service franchises more accessible to a wider range of individuals, including those with limited capital to invest.

Secondly, service franchises often boast higher profit margins. Unlike product franchises, which may face fluctuating costs due to manufacturing, shipping, and storage, service franchises rely primarily on skilled labor and expertise. This allows for greater control over pricing and profit margins, resulting in potentially higher returns on investment.

Moreover, service franchises offer greater flexibility and scalability. They can easily adapt to changing market demands and trends without the need for extensive retooling or inventory management. Additionally, service-based businesses can expand their offerings and reach by diversifying their services or targeting new demographics.

Furthermore, service franchises tend to foster stronger customer relationships and brand loyalty. By providing personalized and specialized services, they can create memorable experiences that keep customers coming back for more.

In conclusion, while product franchises certainly have their merits, service franchises offer distinct advantages in terms of affordability, profitability, flexibility, and customer engagement. For aspiring entrepreneurs seeking a rewarding and sustainable franchising opportunity, service franchises undoubtedly present a compelling choice.

Regards,
Kunnu Singh
Womenpreneur - IIMC

data.blog_name: Service Franchise vs. Product Franchise: Which One is Right for You?
data.blog_content_text:
Starting a Franchise Business in India: Service vs. Product Franchise

Starting a franchise business in India is an exciting venture, but choosing the right model is critical to your success. Two popular options are Service Franchises and Product Franchises, each with its own set of advantages, challenges, and opportunities.

What is a Service Franchise vs. a Product Franchise?

Service Franchise

A Service Franchise revolves around offering specialized services under a recognized brand. Examples include home repair, cleaning, education, healthcare, automotive services, and wellness centers. The franchisor provides training, branding, and operational support to ensure consistent service quality.

Product Franchise

A Product Franchise focuses on selling tangible goods under a well-established brand. Franchisees distribute products supplied by the franchisor, maintaining brand consistency. This model is common in industries like food and beverages, apparel, electronics, and automobiles.

Benefits of a Service Franchise vs. a Product Franchise

Advantages of a Service Franchise

Lower Initial Investment: Minimal inventory requirements mean lower upfront costs.

Recurring Revenue: Services like maintenance, education, or healthcare often generate repeat business.

Flexible Operations: Many service franchises can be operated from home or small offices, reducing overhead costs.

High Demand: Essential services are always in demand, ensuring steady customer flow.

Brand Support: Franchisors provide training, marketing, and operational guidance to maintain service standards.

Advantages of a Product Franchise

Brand Recognition: Established brands attract customers, boosting sales potential.

Exclusive Territory Rights: Many franchisors grant exclusive selling rights in specific regions.

Bulk Purchasing Power: Franchisees benefit from discounted rates on bulk inventory purchases.

Scalability: Multiple retail outlets can be opened to expand revenue streams.

Marketing Support: Franchisors often invest heavily in national or regional marketing campaigns.

Key Differences Between Service and Product Franchises

Feature Service Franchise Product Franchise
Investment Lower Higher (due to inventory costs)
Revenue Model Recurring income from ongoing services One-time sales with potential repeat buys
Scalability Flexible, can be home-based Requires retail space expansion
Brand Control Ensures consistent service quality Ensures standardized product supply
Inventory Management Minimal inventory required Large inventory storage needed

How to Choose the Right Franchise for You

Investment Budget: Service franchises generally require less capital upfront.

Business Experience: If you have expertise in a specific service, a service franchise may be a natural fit.

Location Availability: A prime retail location can make a product franchise more profitable.

Risk Tolerance: Service franchises involve direct customer interaction, while product franchises require inventory management.

Long-Term Goals: Consider scalability, profitability, and your passion for the industry.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

What is the main difference between a service franchise and a product franchise?
A service franchise focuses on offering services, while a product franchise involves selling tangible goods.

Which franchise type is more profitable in India?
Both can be profitable, but service franchises often have lower overhead costs and recurring revenue streams.

What are the initial costs of starting a service franchise?
Initial costs vary but are generally lower due to minimal inventory requirements.

Do I need retail space for a service franchise?
Not necessarily. Many service franchises can be operated from home or small offices.

How does Mannubhai Service Expert support its franchise partners?
We provide training, marketing, and operational support to ensure your success.

Is a service franchise better for first-time entrepreneurs?
Yes, due to lower initial investment and flexible operations.

How can I apply for a Mannubhai franchise?
Visit our website or contact our team to explore available opportunities.

What are the ongoing expenses of running a product franchise?
Ongoing expenses include inventory restocking, rent, and employee salaries.

Which industries are best suited for a service franchise?

The Need for Each Household to Have A Water Purifier

While tap water looks clear, it can have perilous substances such as chlorine, bacteria, heavy metals along with some dissolved salts which pose grave health risks if consumed over time. Regularly consuming these dangerous materials drastically increases the risk without proper filtration system. A well-engineered water purifiers for home use filters makes sure all conceivable risks are mitigated while enabling healthy consumption for all family members. Types of Water Purifying Devices: Reverse Osmosis (RO) Water Purifier: Most effective where Total Dissolved Solids levels are high. UV Water Purifier: Used for disinfection by employing ultraviolet light to eliminate bacteria and viruses. Alkaline Water Purifier: Unlike normal purified water, enhances health benefits by adding essential minerals and balancing PH levels efficiently. Under-Sink Water Purifer: Best for space saving in modular kitchens. Water Filter: Eliminates suspended impurities with distinct dirt and odor.
